components.name: React Frontend
components.description: The user interface built with React, responsible for user interaction, data presentation, and form submission.

components.name: FastAPI Backend
components.description: The API server built with FastAPI, handling user requests, interacting with the database, and performing threat modeling logic.

components.name: PostgreSQL Database
components.description: Stores threat models, associated data, user information, and potentially other application data.

components.name: Repello AI Engine
components.description: The core threat intelligence engine, likely integrated to provide contextual threat data and recommendations.

data_flows.description: User interactions (form submissions, API calls) are sent to the backend for processing.
Threat model data is persisted and retrieved from the database.
The backend requests threat intelligence data from the Repello AI Engine to enrich threat models.
The AI engine returns threat intelligence data to the backend.

trust_boundaries.name: User Interface Trust Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: The React frontend represents a potential trust boundary. Untrusted user input directly interacts with the application, requiring strict validation and sanitization.

trust_boundaries.name: API Trust Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: The API endpoints represent a trust boundary, requiring authentication, authorization, and rate limiting to prevent abuse and unauthorized access.
